params.question: Suffolk County has the highest estimated average age of housing. Allston, Brighton, Chelsea, Dorchester, Jamaica Plain, Mattapan, Revere and Roxbury are all examples of cities located in this county.

behaviour.feedbackOnCorrect: Studies show that multi-unit housing, and home ownership status are associated with higher concentrations for lead service lines in addition to housing age. A multi-unit apartment complex not owned by tenants, may be more likely to have lead service lines compared to a single occupancy home, privately owned.

params.question: The average age of housing is as a risk factor for lead service lines, is also impacted by type of house and ownership status.

behaviour.feedbackOnCorrect: Studies have also demonstrated that age of housing is also dependent on poverty at the neighborhood and individual level as it predicts lead service lines.
behaviour.feedbackOnWrong: Age of Housing as we know is often impacted by other strong risk factors. In this case poverty is also a very strong predictor for presence of lead service lines.

params.question: Neighborhoods with higher rates of poverty and newer homes may have comparable rates of lead service lines with neighborhoods with lower rates of poverty and older homes.
